title: Chennai on flood alert as Chembarambakkam, Poondi, Puzhal reservoirs release water
text:
[Tamil Nadu News](https://www.news9live.com/state/tamil-nadu)
Chennai on flood alert as Chembarambakkam, Poondi, Puzhal reservoirs release water
Chennai is on high alert as water is being released from the Chembarambakkam, Poondi, and Puzhal reservoirs following heavy rains. Authorities have issued flood warnings for low-lying areas, urging residents to evacuate and stay updated on safety measures
Chennai: Authorities issued a flood alert for low-lying areas along the Adyar River banks after releasing 1,000 cusecs of water from Chembarambakkam reservoir today. The reservoir, with a full capacity of 24 feet, currently stands at 23.29 feet, with inflows rising to 6,500 cusecs.
The decision to release water came after heavy rains pounded the Kanchipuram district, with the Chembarambakkam area recording 14 cm rainfall yesterday. This led to a significant increase in inflows, from 743 cubic feet yesterday morning to 6,500 cusecs currently.

[December 13, 2024]
Flood Warnings for Low-Lying Areas
Residents in low-lying areas along the Adyar River banks have been advised to evacuate to relief camps. Water has now been released from the three largest lakes around Chennai – Chembarambakkam, Poondi and Puzhal lakes – resulting in water flowing into the city’s rivers.
Chembarambakkam Lake’s water level rose from 21.50 feet yesterday to over 23 feet, prompting officials to release surplus water. An order was issued to release 1,000 cubic feet per second after the water level crossed 22 feet. Flood warnings have been issued for villages along the banks, including Thirumudivakkam, Sirukalathur, Nandambakkam, Thiruneermalai and Vazhuthalampedu.
Poondi Lake, another key water source for Chennai, has also seen increased water release. Currently, 12,760 cubic feet of water are being released, up from 5,000 cubic feet yesterday. With Poondi Lake overflowing at its full height of 35 feet, officials released additional water as a safety precaution. Puzhal Lake also releases 500 cubic feet of water.
The 2015 Chennai floods were largely caused by water release from Chembarambakkam Lake. While officials from the Water Resources Department and Public Works Department are closely monitoring the situation, residents remain concerned. Authorities ensure that necessary measures are being taken to ensure public safety.
Evacuation efforts are underway, with residents advised to avoid travel to flood-prone areas and follow official updates. The situation remains under close watch as authorities work to mitigate potential flooding.
